title: VR-Based Instrument Learning: Yangqin Performance Education Using Embodied Design and Visual Cues

context.prior_knowledge: Basic music theory and interest in instrumental performance
context.additional_context: Teaching competency enhancement course for preservice or in-service teachers. Aims to develop creative hobbies for workplace stress relief post-return. Establishes self-directed learning environments using VR technology

learning_goals: Learners can perform yanggeum (Korean zither) basic playing techniques (rhythm, fingering, scales) in a VR environment with 80% accuracy
Learners can comparatively analyze differences in VR learning environments applying low/high embodiment design (LoEmb/HiEmb) and visual cues (LoViz/HiViz)
Learners can create a personalized performance portfolio reflecting VR learning experiences through project-based assessment

resources: Bimodal VR learning modules (4 types: LoEmb & LoViz, LoEmb & HiViz, HiEmb & LoViz, HiEmb & HiViz)
VR headset (compatible with HTC Vive/Oculus Quest)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
